title: The failure of Obama's 'leading from behind' in Libya
subhead: 'The Transatlantic Divorce' (2/5). Elected on the promise of no longer sending American troops to the Middle East, President Barack Obama allowed France and the UK to lead the Libyan operation, which resulted in Muammar Gaddafi's fall. He emerged deeply frustrated by the shortcomings of his European allies.

title: 'On the budget, Donald Trump's obsession consists of fulfilling impossible campaign promises'
subhead: After 150 days in office, doubts about the US economic policy are mounting. Widespread uncertainty, serious damage to the country's credibility, and the rising deficit threaten the international financial system's stability, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

title: How the US divided Europe to invade Iraq at any cost in 2003
subhead: 'The Transatlantic Divorce' (1/5). In the aftermath of September 11, American neoconservatives made plans to attack Iraq, despite opposition from France and Germany. From then on, to achieve its aims, the White House relied on its allies in Eastern Europe, dividing the European family for years to come.
